This game is a prime example of a game that ages well no matter how long it's been out. If you're a fan of story-based puzzle games, this will probably become one of your favorites. The graphics are simple but satisfying, suitable for the environment, and (although it's already out,) perfect sequel material. The one complaint I had when I played this game 4 years ago was that the story was too vague (of course I was an uncultered milquetoast 16 year old,) and it was quickly solved with Portal 2 and gave more depth to the story. However, if you're just along for the puzzles and not the story, you're in for a treat in that department; The critical thinking this game takes isn't overwhelming and due to that, this game can transcend generations of all gamers alike. Highly will continue to recommend to anyone who likes to sharpen their skills and use portals to cross/fly across a room or even the whole map. Forever on my list of favorite games.

La saga portal me ha llegado al corazón. Me he emocionado con su historia, con las IAs, con los grafitis de doug rattmann contándo la historia de lo que paso antes de despertar. Son unos juegos que me han durado nada, los rompecabezas a los que me iba enfrentando me han parecido brillantes y desafiantes. Los misterios que hay en algunos de los misterios son muy interesantes

Portal es uno de mis juegos favoritos de la vida diría, un juego que, cuando lo jugué por primera vez, siento que me cambió la forma en la que pensaba los juegos. Era el primero que yo recordaba haber jugado de "puzzles", y eso por sí sólo era interesante, pero un villano tan carismático, toda la cuestión ciencia-ficción, las físicas novedosas de los portales (la primera vez que lo ví no lo podía creer). Es un juego que me sorprendió constantemente, y que no sólo lo recuerdo con cariño, sino que habiendolo jugado de nuevo tantos años despues, siento que no envejeció ni un poco.

Compralo, no te vas a arrepentir.

[h1]I'm making this review a little late, but I've gotten the urge to redo all the games in the Portal series, so here's my review[/h1]

Portal is a very original and creative game, a gameplay never seen before (at least I think so?), a mysterious atmosphere that intrigues us, and puzzle rooms to solve that are neither too easy nor too difficult (without counting the first test rooms).

But what makes Portal even more awesome is the story that the series has, all the hidden lore, the very mysterious secret places that we can come across during the game


We ask ourselves a lot of questions, so who is this robotic voice speaking to us through the test rooms? Why is no human except ourselves in the building? Why are murderous tests legal on humans? Who is this giant robot we come across at the end of the game? All these questions that are answered only by advancing in the game or by doing research on the game's lore (like on a wiki or something), a really very interesting and well done story.

[h1][u]Portal is a masterpiece that must absolutely be played[/u][/h1]

I got into this game years late, but it's still very much enjoyable. I mean, what's there not to love about a physics-based puzzle game? Games like this are a refreshment to me. I'd even recommend this for people who are new to gaming in general. It's that good. 
-
While there's a lot of mental power that goes into solving puzzles, especially late game puzzles, it doesn't take away from what makes this game fun.
The portal gun is a "BLAST" (Get it?) to use to get around the rooms more quickly if you wanted. There are ways you can really cheese your way through some of the levels but that's for more advanced players who are used to the puzzles, room layouts and know about the noteworthy glitches. It's greatly designed, but not quite perfect.
-
Normally I would get into story details but this is a review not a plot summary. But trust me when I say, if you like puzzle games you'll really like Portal. Story is also engaging to follow along with.
I've owned this game on 3 different platforms and I still run it through a few times a year.
